P. L. Sperr.

selves out for od1 jobs.

719697f-a.title: Manhattan: Essex Street - Houston Street (East)
719697f-a.text:
Essex Street, south from East Houston Street. Note the Provident Loan
Association Building on the right. Structures that formerly lined the east
side of this thoroughfare have been demolished in the course of widening.
July 14, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
719697f-a.folder: Essex Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

719698f-a.title: Manhattan: Essex Street - Houston Street (East)

Essex Street, east side, south from East Houston Street.
March 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719698f-a.folder: Essex Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY

710836f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Street - Avenue A
710836f-b.text:
120 and 240-252 1st Street, north side, at Avenue A, seen from
Houston Street across the clearing between Houston and 1st Streets
March 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

719503f-b.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Essex Street
719503f-b.text:
(1)
East Houston Street, south side, east from Essex Street, showing the
block from Essex to Norfolk Streets, after the demolition of P.S. No.
13. Also shown (across clearance) are Nos. 190 to 184 Norfolk Street,
at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of East Houston Street.
April 28, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at a later date, as seen from Essex Street. (extreme
foreground) and including a view of the west side of the street.
May 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719503f-b.folder: Houston Street (East) & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

710836f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Street - Avenue A
710836f-a.text:
120 and 240-252 1st Street, north side, at Avenue A, seen from
Houston Street across the clearing between Houston and 1st Streets
March 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

719499f-c.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Avenue A
719499f-c.text:
(1)
East Houston Street, north side, vest from Ave. ''A.'' Also shown is
1-3 Ave. ''A'' (5-story building at apex), west side, between East Houston
and East 1st (extreme right) Streets. These houses were later demolished
to make room for the construction of the Independent Subway System
(Eighth Ave. Subway). IIn the foreground is shown the entrance to B. S.
No. 13.
December 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A portion of the same prior to the demolition shown in No. 1. This
view is westward from No. 210, (shown on the extreme right), as seen from
Ludlow Street. Note the Second Ave. Elevated Line on Allen Street.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A view northward through clearance shown in No. 1. Appearing
across same are buildings on the north side of East 1st Street, between
First Ave. (left, not shown) and Ave. A (right, not shown). This view
is as seen north from Ludlow Street.
December 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719499f-c.folder: Houston Street (East) & Avenue A, Manhattan, NY

178-184 Essex Street, adjoining, nd at the S.E. corner of
Houston Street. The view also shows Avenue A, west side, north of
Houston Street. Public School Number 13 is at the right.
July 17, 1929.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODU1TIONS.

719501f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Essex Street
719501f-a.text:
225 to 217 East Houston Street, at and adjoining the S. W. corner of
Easex Street, as seen across clearance on the west side of Avenue A, between
East 1st and Houston Streets. Also shown (left) is No. 181 Essex Street,
adjoining the Provident Loan Association Building, No's 223-225 East Houston,
and i83 Essex Streets. The 7 story factory building shown on the right is
No. 181 Ludlow Street,,west side, south of Houston Street.
April 3, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTION.
